Package model

Class Customer

java.lang.Object
model.Customer
public class Customer extends Object
Customer Class is developed to manage customer data imported from the customers table in the client_schedule database Setters are not defined because all item changes and additions are intended to be managed in the database not the objects.

  • Constructor Details

    • Customer

      public Customer(int customerId, String customerName, String address, String postalCode, String phone, Date createDateTime, String createdBy, Date lastUpdateDateTime, String lastUpdateBy, int divisionId, String divisionName, String countryName)
      Sets reference variables used to refer to Customer class constructor.
      Parameters:
      customerId - The customer ID imported from the customers table in the client_schedule database
      customerName - The customer name imported from the customers table in the client_schedule database
      address - The customer address imported from the customers table in the client_schedule database
      postalCode - The customer postal code imported from the customers table in the client_schedule database
      phone - The customer phone number imported from the customers table in the client_schedule database
      createDateTime - The customer creation date and time imported from the customers table in the client_schedule database
      createdBy - The customer created by username string imported from the customers table in the client_schedule database
      lastUpdateDateTime - The customer last updated date and time imported from the customers table in the client_schedule database
      lastUpdateBy - The customer last update by username string imported from the customers table in the client_schedule database
      divisionId - The customer division ID imported from the customers table in the client_schedule database
      divisionName - The customer division name imported from the customers table in the client_schedule database
      countryName - The customer country name

    • getAllCustomers

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Customer> getAllCustomers()
      Retries all customers from the allCustomers ObservableList.
      Returns:
      Returns an observableList containing all customers.

    • addCustomer

    • getAllCustomerNames

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> getAllCustomerNames()
      Gets an ObservableList containing all customer names Lambda Expression: I used a lambda expression here to improve the readability of my for loop reducing potential bugs in the code. This expression is also more concise meaning there is slightly less code required to perform the same function which will make my code easier to maintain.
      Returns:
      Returns an ObservableList containing all customer names as strings

    • getCustomerIdByName

      public static int getCustomerIdByName(String searchName)
      Retries the customer id based on a passed in customer name. Lambda Expression: I used a lambda expression here to improve the readability of my for loop reducing potential bugs in the code. This expression is also more concise meaning there is slightly less code required to perform the same function which will make my code easier to maintain.
      Parameters:
      searchName - Customer name to search for
      Returns:
      Returns a customer id as an integer based on the passed in customer name

    • getCustomerNameById

      public static String getCustomerNameById(int customerId)
      Retries the customer name based on a passed in customer id. Lambda Expression: I used a lambda expression here to improve the readability of my for loop reducing potential bugs in the code. This expression is also more concise meaning there is slightly less code required to perform the same function which will make my code easier to maintain.
      Parameters:
      customerId - Customer id to search for
      Returns:
      Returns a customer id as an integer based on the passed in customer name

    • getDatabaseCustomers

      public static void getDatabaseCustomers()
      Pulls a query of all customer items in the customers table from the client_schedule database then creates customer objects for those items. Produces an error prompt if unable to retrieve data from the database.

    • insertCustomer

      public static void insertCustomer(int id, String name, String address, String postalCode, String phone, int divisionId, String user, String menu, int selectedCustomerId)
      Commits changes or creates new customers in the customers table of the client_schedule database. Produces error prompt if unable to retrieve data from the database.
      Parameters:
      id - Customer id integer
      name - Customer name string
      address - Customer address string
      postalCode - Customer postal code string
      phone - Customer phone number string
      divisionId - Customer division id integer
      user - Customer username string
      menu - Customer menu string
      selectedCustomerId - Selected customer id integer

    • remeoveCustomer

      public static void remeoveCustomer(int id)
      Removes a customer from the customer table in the client_schedule database. Produces an error prompt if unable to remove the appointment from the database.
      Parameters:
      id - Customer ID for customer to be removed.
